title: Man arrested after walking with stolen AR-15 on Broadway in downtown Nashville 20 hours ago
content: NASHVILLE, Tenn. —   Metro Nashville Police arrested a 63-year-old man, who was walking on Broadway with a stolen AR-15 and car burglary tools on Thursday.    Police said Michael Ray Jenkins was spotted walking down Broadway carrying the weapon and magazines of ammunition around 10:30 p.m.    Officers canvassed the area around Broadway before being flagged down by people who saw where he was headed. Jenkins was eventually found with the AR-15 rifle in an alley on Patterson street.    According to the investigation, Jenkins broke into a vehicle parked at the DawgHouse Saloon on Demonbreun Street. That's where he found the AR-15 and ammunition before he started walking around with the weapon.     Police say Jenkins has a history of breaking into cars. He was found with a bent screwdriver and other items stolen from the vehicle.    Jenkins was charged with auto burglary, possession of a burglary tool, and unlawful gun possession by a convicted felon. He was jailed on a $24,000 bond.
